Grace, ''Notes on the phonological history of the Austronesian languages of the Sarmi Coast'', in ''Oceanic Linguistics'' (1971, 10:11-37) ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|mÄ«n}}, from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*mÄ«naz}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/maÉªÌ¯n/}} * {{audio|de|De-mein.ogg|audio}} * {{rhymes|de|aÉªÌ¯n}} * {{homophone|de|meinen}} {{a|according to a common pronunciation of this form}} ===Determiner=== {{head|de|determiner|cat2=possessive determiners}} # {{lb|de|possessive}} [[my]] ====Inflection==== {{de-decl-pronoun|mein|meine|mein|meine|meines|meiner|meines|meiner|meinem|meiner|meinem|meinen|meinen|meine|mein|meine}} When used as a possessive pronoun, the nominative masculine takes the form {{m|de|meiner}}, which equals English "mine", and the nominative/accusative neuter takes the form {{m|de|meines}} or {{m|de|meins}}. * dein Vater und '''meiner''' â€“ your father and mine * dein Kind und '''mein'''(e)'''s''' â€“ your child and mine When the pronoun is placed after a noun, it is left uninflected: * Gen Himmel zu dem Vater '''mein''' fahr ich von diesem Leben (song ''Nun freut euch, lieben Christen g'mein'') â€“ Towards Heaven to my father go I from this life. ===Pronoun=== {{head|de|pronoun form}} # {{lb|de|dated}} {{inflection of|de|ich||gen}} {{cln|de|first person pronouns}} ---- ==Gothic== ===Romanization=== {{got-rom}} # {{romanization of|got|ğŒ¼ğŒ´ğŒ¹ğŒ½}} ---- ==Hunsrik== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|hrx|goh|mÄ«n}}, from {{inh|hrx|gem-pro|*mÄ«naz}}.
